Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
SystemEnvironment.Simulator
public class Simulator extends Object
Top-level simulation orchestrator that ties together the Processor, workload/resource settings and result collection.

The Simulator performs the following high-level sequence in start():

  1. Partition tasks (for SingleCore / Partition scheduling modes).
  2. Calculate fixed priorities if the chosen scheduling algorithm is fixed.
  3. Run controller pre-action hooks (lock / protocol initialization).
  4. Invoke DVFS speed definition on the regulator.
  5. Iteratively execute one simulation time unit until simulationTime is reached (using global or per-core execution path based on Definition.SchedulingType).
  6. Finalize per-core scheduling records and accumulate power usage.
  7. Collect miss-deadline information and produce a ResultSet.
Inline comments (including Chinese remarks) have been integrated: final recording, power consumption printing, and deadline miss counting. Time consumption of the whole run is measured using System.currentTimeMillis().

Configuration setters allow adjustment of simulation time, context switch time and migration time prior to start; after execution, getters expose elapsed time and results.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulator

      public Simulator()
      Constructs a simulator with no loaded processor, zero simulation and elapsed time, and an empty ResultSet. Context switch and migration times default to 0. Use loadDataSetting(DataSetting) to populate the processor and workload before calling start().

  • Method Details

    • loadDataSetting

      public void loadDataSetting(DataSetting ds)
      Loads a prepared DataSetting (processor, task set, shared resource set) into the simulator. Also sets this simulator as the parent of the processor so it can report events (e.g., deadline misses).
      Parameters:
      ds - the data setting containing processor, tasks and resources

    • addCoreInfo

      public void addCoreInfo(Core c)
      Adds all scheduling information associated with a core into the result set. (Core info currently includes power consumption and scheduling timeline.)
      Parameters:
      c - the core whose information should be recorded

    • addMissDeadlineInfo

      public void addMissDeadlineInfo(MissDeadlineInfo md)
      Records a deadline miss information object into the result set.
      Parameters:
      md - the miss-deadline info to add

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the simulation run loop until simulationTime is reached.

      Sequence: partition tasks, calculate fixed priorities, controller pre-action, DVFS speed definition, then iterate executing 1 time unit at a time using either global or local execution based on scheduling type. After the loop it finalizes each core's last SchedulingInfo, records power consumption, aggregates core info and prints summary statistics (missed deadlines, per-core power, total elapsed wall-clock time).

    • setSimulationTime

      public void setSimulationTime(long i)
      Sets the total planned simulation time (in simulation time units) to execute.
      Parameters:
      i - the simulation duration

    • setContextSwitchTime

      public void setContextSwitchTime(long i)
      Sets the context switch duration applied when cores perform a context switch.
      Parameters:
      i - context switch time units

    • setMigrationTime

      public void setMigrationTime(long i)
      Sets the migration duration applied when jobs migrate between cores.
      Parameters:
      i - migration time units

    • getProcessor

      public Processor getProcessor()
      Returns the processor currently loaded into this simulator.
      Returns:
      the processor (may be null if not yet loaded)

    • getElapsedTime

      public long getElapsedTime()
      Returns the amount of simulated time already executed.
      Returns:
      elapsed simulation time

    • getSimulationTime

      public long getSimulationTime()
      Returns the total simulation time target configured.
      Returns:
      planned simulation duration

    • getContextSwitchTime

      public long getContextSwitchTime()
      Returns the configured context switch time.
      Returns:
      context switch time units

    • getMigrationTime

      public long getMigrationTime()
      Returns the configured migration time.
      Returns:
      migration time units

    • getResultSet

      public ResultSet getResultSet()
      Returns the accumulated result set containing core info and deadline miss data.
      Returns:
      simulation result set
